result.execSummary:
The defendant Brayan Tomas Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is to pay costs directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant is to gain and maintain employment of at least 25 hours a week or as directed by his Agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with GCR, EO, JO, or MO  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant may apply for expunction after successfully completing and satisfying all conditions of probation and has no other criminal charges against him.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Defendant is to write an apology letter of no less than 200 words and approved by his agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to find his own Community Service and must be approved by his Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brayan Tomas Ramirez

records.addlTxt: 09:43 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Brayan Tomas Ramirez, appeared with Attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  State is in compliance with victim rights law.  Victims statement was read on the record.  Restitution requested.    The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea, knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.
